0
AN LA PUCELLE, Commonly called JOAN OF ARC
  JOAN 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
AN LA PUCELLE, Commonly called JOAN OF ARC
    to La Pucelle
  BEDFORD. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Hung be the heavens with black, yield day to
  GLOUCESTER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. England ne'er had a king until his time.
  EXETER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. We mourn in black; why mourn we not in blood?
  WINCHESTER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NCHESTER. He was a king bless'd of the King of kings;
  GLOUCESTER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. The Church! Where is it? Had not churchmen
  WINCHESTER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NCHESTER. Gloucester, whate'er we like, thou art
  GLOUCESTER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. Name not religion, for thou lov'st the flesh;
  BEDFORD. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Cease, cease these jars and rest your minds in peace;
  HENRY 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NRY the Fifth, thy ghost I invocate:
  HENRY 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NRY the Fifth, thy ghost I invocate:
    Prosper this realm, keep it from civil broils,
    Combat with adverse planets in the heavens.
    A far more glorious star thy soul will make
    Than Julius Caesar or bright
  MESSENGER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
SSENGER. My honourable lords, health to you all!
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. What say'st thou, man, before dead Henry's corse?
  GLOUCESTER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. Is Paris lost? Is Rouen yielded up?
  EXETER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. How were they lost? What treachery was us'd?
  MESSENGER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
SSENGER. No treachery, but want of men and money.
  EXETER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. Were our tears wanting to this funeral,
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Me they concern; Regent I am of France.
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Me they concern; Regent I am of France.
    Give me my steeled coat; I'll fight for France.
    Away with these disgraceful wailing robes!
    Wounds will I lend the French instead of eyes,
    To weep their intermissive miseries.
  SECOND 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
COND MESSENGER. Lords, view these letters full of bad
  EXETER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. The Dauphin crowned king! all fly to him!
  GLOUCESTER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. We will not fly but to our enemies' throats.
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Gloucester, why doubt'st thou of my forwardness?
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Gloucester, why doubt'st thou of my forwardness?
    An army have I muster'd in my thoughts,
    Wherewith already France is overrun.
  THIRD 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
IRD MESSENGER. My gracious lords, to add to your
  WINCHESTER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NCHESTER. What! Wherein Talbot overcame? Is't so?
  THIRD 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
IRD MESSENGER. O, no; wherein Lord Talbot was
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Is Talbot slain? Then I will slay myself,
  THIRD 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
IRD MESSENGER. O no, he lives, but is took prisoner,
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. His ransom there is none but I shall pay.
  THIRD 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
IRD MESSENGER. So you had need; for Orleans is besieg'd;
  EXETER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. Remember, lords, your oaths to Henry sworn,
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. I do remember it, and here take my leave
  GLOUCESTER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. I'll to the Tower with all the haste I can
  EXETER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. To Eltham will I, where the young King is,
  WINCHESTER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NCHESTER.  [Aside]  Each hath his place and function to
  WINCHESTER. 
3
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
NCHESTER.  [Aside]  Each hath his place and function to
    attend:
    I am left out; for me nothing remains.
    But long I will not be Jack out of office.
    The King from Eltham I intend to steal,
    And sit at chiefest stern of public weal.             Exeunt
                          SCENE 2.
                  France. Before Orleans
  CHARLES. 
3
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Mars his true moving, even as in the heavens
  ALENCON. 
3
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. They want their porridge and their fat bull
  REIGNIER. 
3
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. Let's raise the siege. Why live we idly here?
  CHARLES. 
3
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Sound, sound alarum; we will rush on them.
  CHARLES. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Sound, sound alarum; we will rush on them.
    Now for the honour of the forlorn French!
    Him I forgive my death that killeth me,
    When he sees me go back one foot or flee.             Exeunt
       Here alarum. They are beaten hack by the English, with
  CHARLES. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Who ever saw the like? What men have I!
  REIGNIER. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. Salisbury is a desperate homicide;
  ALENCON. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. Froissart, a countryman of ours, records
  CHARLES. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Let's leave this town; for they are hare-brain'd
  REIGNIER. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. I think by some odd gimmers or device
  ALENCON. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. Be it so.
  BASTARD. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
STARD. Where's the Prince Dauphin? I have news for him.
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Bastard of Orleans, thrice welcome to us.
  BASTARD. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
STARD. Methinks your looks are sad, your cheer appall'd.
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Go, call her in.                       [Exit BASTARD]
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Go, call her in.                       [Exit BASTARD]
    But first, to try her skill,
    Reignier, stand thou as Dauphin in my place;
    Question her proudly; let thy looks be stern;
    By this means shall we sound what skill she hath.
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. Fair maid, is 't thou wilt do these wondrous feats?
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Reignier, is 't thou that thinkest to beguile me?
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. She takes upon her bravely at first dash.
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Dauphin, I am by birth a shepherd's daughter,
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Thou hast astonish'd me with thy high terms.
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. I am prepar'd; here is my keen-edg'd sword,
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Then come, o' God's name; I fear no woman.
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. And while I live I'll ne'er fly from a man.
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Stay, stay thy hands; thou art an Amazon,
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Christ's Mother helps me, else I were too weak.
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Whoe'er helps thee, 'tis thou that must help me.
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. I must not yield to any rites of love,
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Meantime look gracious on thy prostrate thrall.
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. My lord, methinks, is very long in talk.
  ALENCON. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. Doubtless he shrives this woman to her smock;
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. Shall we disturb him, since he keeps no mean?
  ALENCON. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. He may mean more than we poor men do know;
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. My lord, where are you? What devise you on?
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Why, no, I say; distrustful recreants!
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. What she says I'll confirm; we'll fight it out.
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Assign'd am I to be the English scourge.
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Was Mahomet inspired with a dove?
  ALENCON. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. Leave off delays, and let us raise the siege.
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. Woman, do what thou canst to save our honours;
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Presently we'll try. Come, let's away about it.
  CHARLES. 
6
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Presently we'll try. Come, let's away about it.
    No prophet will I trust if she prove false.           Exeunt
                          SCENE 3.
                London. Before the Tower gates

  GLOUCESTER. 
6
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
OUCESTER. Faint-hearted Woodville, prizest him fore me?
  GLOUCESTER. 
7
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
OUCESTER. Faint-hearted Woodville, prizest him fore me?
    Arrogant Winchester, that haughty prelate
    Whom Henry, our late sovereign, ne'er could brook!
    Thou art no friend to God or to the King.
    Open the gates, or I'll shut thee out shortly.
    Or we'll burst them open, if that you come not quickly.
  WINCHESTER. 
7
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
NCHESTER. How now, ambitious Humphry! What means
  GLOUCESTER. 
7
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
OUCESTER. Peel'd priest, dost thou command me to be
  WINCHESTER. 
7
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
NCHESTER. I do, thou most usurping proditor,
  GLOUCESTER.

  WINCHESTER.

  GLOUCESTER. 
8
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
OUCESTER. Winchester goose! I cry 'A rope, a rope!'
    Now beat them hence; why do you let them stay?
    Thee I'll chase hence, thou wolf in sheep's array.
    Out, tawny-coats! Out, scarlet hypocrite!
         Here GLOUCESTER'S men beat out the CARDINAL'S
  MAYOR.

  GLOUCESTER.

PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
Y. Father, I warrant you; take you no care;
  BOY. 
9
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
Y. Father, I warrant you; take you no care;
    I'll never trouble you, if I may spy them.              Exit
  SALISBURY. 
9

LISBURY. Talbot, my life, my joy, again return'd!
  TALBOT.

  SALISBURY. 
9
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER

  TALBOT. 
9
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. With scoffs, and scorns, and contumelious taunts,
  TALBOT. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. With scoffs, and scorns, and contumelious taunts,
    In open market-place produc'd they me
    To be a public spectacle to all;
    Here, said they, is the terror of the French,
    The scarecrow that affrights our children so.
    Then broke I from the officers that led me,
    And with my nails digg'd stones out of the ground
    To hurl at the beholders of my shame;
    My grisly countenance made others fly;
    None durst come near for fear of sudden death.
    In iron walls they deem'd me not secure;
    So great fear of my name 'mongst them was spread
    That they suppos'd I could rend bars of steel
    And spurn in pieces posts of adamant;
    Wherefore a guard of chosen shot I had
    That walk'd about me every minute-while;
    And if I did but stir out of my bed,
    Ready they were to shoot me to the heart.
  SALISBURY. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LISBURY. I grieve to hear what torments you endur'd;
  GARGRAVE.

10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES

SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
RGRAVE. O Lord, have mercy on me, woeful man!
  TALBOT. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. What chance is this that suddenly hath cross'd us?
  TALBOT. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. What chance is this that suddenly hath cross'd us?
    Speak, Salisbury; at least, if thou canst speak.
    How far'st thou, mirror of all martial men?
    One of thy eyes and thy cheek's side struck off!
    Accursed tower! accursed fatal hand
    That hath contriv'd this woeful tragedy!
    In thirteen battles Salisbury o'ercame;
    Henry the Fifth he first train'd to the wars;
    Whilst any trump did sound or drum struck up,
    His sword did ne'er leave striking in the field.
    Yet liv'st thou, Salisbury? Though thy speech doth fail,
    One eye thou hast to look to heaven for grace;
    The sun with one eye vieweth all the world.
    Heaven, be thou gracious to none alive
    If Salisbury wants mercy at thy hands!
    Bear hence his body; I will help to bury it.
    Sir Thomas Gargrave, hast thou any life?
    Speak unto Talbot; nay, look up to him.
    Salisbury, cheer thy spirit with this comfort,
    Thou shalt not die whiles
    He beckons with his hand and smiles on me,
    As who should say 'When I am dead and gone,
    Remember to avenge me on the French.'
    Plantagenet, I will; and like thee, Nero,
    Play on the lute, beholding the towns burn.
    Wretched shall France be only in my name.
                  [Here an alarum, and it thunders and lightens]
    What stir is this? What tumult's in the heavens?
    Whence cometh this alarum and the noise?
  MESSENGER. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
SSENGER. My lord, my lord, the French have gather'd
  TALBOT. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. Hear, hear how dying Salisbury doth groan.
  TALBOT. 
12
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. Hear, hear how dying Salisbury doth groan.
    It irks his heart he cannot be reveng'd.
    Frenchmen, I'll be a Salisbury to you.
    Pucelle or puzzel, dolphin or dogfish,
    Your hearts I'll stamp out with my horse's heels
    And make a quagmire of your mingled brains.
    Convey me Salisbury into his tent,
    And then we'll try what these dastard Frenchmen dare.
                                                  Alarum. Exeunt
                             SCENE 5.
                          Before Orleans
         Here an alarum again, and TALBOT pursueth the
  TALBOT. 
12
BOY

LA PUCELLE
BOY

SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. Where is my strength, my valour, and my force?
    Our English troops retire, I cannot stay them;
    A woman clad in armour chaseth them.
  PUCELLE. 
13

13
LA PUCELLE

13
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. My thoughts are whirled like a potter's wheel;
  TALBOT. 
12
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. My thoughts are whirled like a potter's wheel;
    I know not where I am nor what I do.
    A witch by fear, not force, like Hannibal,
    Drives back our troops and conquers as she lists.
    So bees with smoke and doves with noisome stench
    Are from their hives and houses driven away.
    They call'd us, for our fierceness, English dogs;
    Now like to whelps we crying run away.
                                                [A short alarum]
    Hark, countrymen! Either renew the fight
    Or tear the lions out of England's coat;
    Renounce your soil, give sheep in lions' stead:
    Sheep run not half so treacherous from the wolf,
    Or horse or oxen from the leopard,
    As you fly from your oft subdued slaves.
                                 [Alarum. Here another skirmish]
    It will not be-retire into your trenches.
    You all consented unto Salisbury's death,
    For none would strike a stroke in his revenge.
    Pucelle is ent'red into Orleans
    In spite of us or aught that we could do.
    O, would I were to die with Salisbury!
    The shame hereof will make me hide my head.
                                    Exit TALBOT. Alarum; retreat
  TALBOT. 
12

                             SCENE 6.
                              ORLEANS
  PUCELLE.

LA PUCELLE

DUKE OF GLOUCESTER

  CHARLES. 
13
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. 'Tis Joan, not we, by whom the day is won;
    For which I will divide my crown with her;
    And all the priests and friars in my realm
    Shall in procession sing her endless praise.
    A statelier pyramis to her I'll rear
    Than Rhodope's of Memphis ever was.
    In memory of her, when she is dead,
    Her ashes, in an urn more precious
    Than the rich jewel'd coffer of Darius,
    Transported shall be at high festivals
    Before the kings and queens of France.
    No longer on Saint Denis will we cry,
    But Joan la Pucelle shall be France's saint.
    Come in, and let us banquet royally
    After this golden day of victory. Flourish.           Exeunt
  SERGEANT. 
13

    Thus are poor servitors,
    When others sleep upon their quiet beds,
    Constrain'd to watch in darkness, rain, and cold.
  TALBOT.

LA PUCELLE

ENCON. Had all your quarters been as safely kept
  BASTARD.

  PUCELLE.

CELLE. Question, my lords, no further of the case,
  PUCELLE. 
15
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Question, my lords, no further of the case,
    How or which way; 'tis sure they found some place
    But weakly guarded, where the breach was made.
    And now there rests no other shift but this
    To gather our soldiers, scatter'd and dispers'd,
    And lay new platforms to endamage them.
  SOLDIER. 
15
LA PUCELLE

JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LDIER. I'll be so bold to take what they have left.
  SOLDIER. 
15
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LDIER. I'll be so bold to take what they have left.
    The cry of Talbot serves me for a sword;
    For I have loaden me with many spoils,
    Using no other weapon but his name.                     Exit

                      ORLEANS. Within the town
  BEDFORD.

LA PUCELLE

TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER

CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
RGUNDY. Myself, as far as I could well discern
  BURGUNDY. 
15
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
RGUNDY. Myself, as far as I could well discern
    For smoke and dusky vapours of the night,
    Am sure I scar'd the Dauphin and his trull,
    When arm in arm they both came swiftly running,
    Like to a pair of loving turtle-doves
    That could not live asunder day or night.
    After that things are set in order here,
    We'll follow them with all the power we have.
  MESSENGER. 
15

  TALBOT.

16
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
UNTESS. The plot is laid; if all things fall out right,
    I shall as famous be by this exploit.
    As Scythian Tomyris by Cyrus' death.
    Great is the rumour of this dreadful knight,
    And his achievements of no less account.
    Fain would mine eyes be witness with mine ears
    To give their censure of these rare reports.
  MESSENGER. 
16

TALBOT
PORTER With
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ANTAGENET. Tut, tut, here is a mannerly forbearance:
  SOMERSET.

    Come, let us four to dinner. I dare say
    This quarrel will drink blood another day.            Exeunt
                             SCENE 5.
                       The Tower of London
  MORTIMER.

  FIRST

RST KEEPER. Richard Plantagenet, my lord, will come.
  MORTIMER. 
19
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER

SALISBURY

PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
RTIMER. Enough; my soul shall then be satisfied.
  MORTIMER. 
20
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
TALBOT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
RTIMER. Enough; my soul shall then be satisfied.
    Poor gentleman! his wrong doth equal mine.
    Since Henry Monmouth first began to reign,
    Before whose glory I was great in arms,
    This loathsome sequestration have I had;
    And even since then hath Richard been obscur'd,
    Depriv'd of honour and inheritance.
    But now the arbitrator of despairs,
    Just Death, kind umpire of men's miseries,
    With sweet enlargement doth dismiss me hence.
    I would his troubles likewise were expir'd,
    That so he might recover what was lost.
  FIRST 
20
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH

COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN

  MORTIMER.

BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ANTAGENET. Discover more at large what cause that was,
  MORTIMER.

20
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
TALBOT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ANTAGENET. And peace, no war, befall thy parting soul!
    In prison hast thou spent a pilgrimage,
    And like a hermit overpass'd thy days.
    Well, I will lock his counsel in my breast;
    And what I do imagine, let that rest.
    Keepers, convey him hence; and I myself
    Will see his burial better than his life.
                Exeunt GAOLERS, hearing out the body of MORTIMER
  PLANTAGENET. 
21
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
TALBOT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
KING
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ANTAGENET. And peace, no war, befall thy parting soul!
    In prison hast thou spent a pilgrimage,
    And like a hermit overpass'd thy days.
    Well, I will lock his counsel in my breast;
    And what I do imagine, let that rest.
    Keepers, convey him hence; and I myself
    Will see his burial better than his life.
                Exeunt GAOLERS, hearing out the body of MORTIMER
    Here dies the dusky torch of Mortimer,
    Chok'd with ambition of the meaner sort;
    And for those wrongs, those bitter injuries,
    Which Somerset hath offer'd to my house,
    I doubt not but with honour to redress;
    And therefore haste I to the Parliament,
    Either to be restored to my blood,
    Or make my ill th' advantage of my good.                Exit
  WINCHESTER. 
21

LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
YOR. O, my good lords, and virtuous Henry,
    Pity the city of London, pity us!
    The Bishop and the Duke of Gloucester's men,
    Forbidden late to carry any weapon,
    Have fill'd their pockets full of pebble stones
    And, banding themselves in contrary parts,
    Do pelt so fast at one another's pate
    That many have their giddy brains knock'd out.
    Our windows are broke down in every street,
    And we for fear compell'd to shut our shops.
  KING 
23

  FIRST

MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
NCHESTER. He shall submit, or I will never yield.
  GLOUCESTER.

  EXETER. 
23
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
ETER. Ay, we may march in England or in France,
    Not seeing what is likely to ensue.
    This late dissension grown betwixt the peers
    Burns under feigned ashes of forg'd love
    And will at last break out into a flame;
    As fest'red members rot but by degree
    Till bones and flesh and sinews fall away,
    So will this base and envious discord breed.
    And now I fear that fatal prophecy.
    Which in the time of Henry nam'd the Fifth
    Was in the mouth of every sucking babe:
    That Henry born at Monmouth should win all,
    And Henry born at Windsor should lose all.
    Which is so plain that Exeter doth wish
    His days may finish ere that hapless time.              Exit
                             SCENE 2.
                      France. Before Rouen
  PUCELLE. 
23

COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
STARD. See, noble Charles, the beacon of our friend;
  CHARLES. 
23
LA PUCELLE

ARLES. Now shine it like a comet of revenge,
  ALENCON.

JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
ENCON. Defer no time, delays have dangerous ends;
    Enter, and cry 'The Dauphin!' presently,
    And then do execution on the watch. Alarum.           Exeunt
  TALBOT. 
23

  PUCELLE,

LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY

TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON

CHARLES THE DAUPHIN

SALISBURY

FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
CELLE, that witch, that damned sorceress,
    Hath wrought this hellish mischief unawares,
    That hardly we escap'd the pride of France.             Exit
        An alarum; excursions. BEDFORD brought in sick in
  PUCELLE. 
23

  BURGUNDY.

LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
LBOT. Undaunted spirit in a dying breast!
    Then be it so. Heavens keep old Bedford safe!
    And now no more ado, brave Burgundy,
    But gather we our forces out of hand
    And set upon our boasting enemy.
          Exeunt against the town all but BEDFORD and attendants
  CAPTAIN.

LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON

DUKE OF GLOUCESTER

SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
DFORD. Now, quiet soul, depart when heaven please,
    For I have seen our enemies' overthrow.
    What is the trust or strength of foolish man?
    They that of late were daring with their scoffs
    Are glad and fain by flight to save themselves.
            [BEDFORD dies and is carried in by two in his chair]
  TALBOT. 
24

SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE

GLOUCESTER
LBOT. But yet, before we go, let's not forget
  TALBOT. 
24
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
LBOT. But yet, before we go, let's not forget
    The noble Duke of Bedford, late deceas'd,
    But see his exequies fulfill'd in Rouen.
    A braver soldier never couched lance,
    A gentler heart did never sway in court;
    But kings and mightiest potentates must die,
    For that's the end of human misery.                   Exeunt
                             SCENE 3.
                      The plains near Rouen
  PUCELLE. 
24
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT

PORTER With
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
CELLE. Dismay not, Princes, at this accident,
  CHARLES. 
24
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER

LA PUCELLE

TALBOT

MAYOR OF LONDON

BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
CELLE. Your honours shall perceive how I will work
    To bring this matter to the wished end.
                                          [Drum sounds afar off]
    Hark! by the sound of drum you may perceive
    Their powers are marching unto Paris-ward.
          Here sound an English march. Enter, and pass over
                at a distance, TALBOT and his forces
    There goes the Talbot, with his colours spread,
    And all the troops of English after him.
  CHARLES. 
25

25
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
NG HENRY. Welcome, brave captain and victorious lord!
    When I was young, as yet I am not old,
    I do remember how my father said
    A stouter champion never handled sword.
    Long since we were resolved of your truth,
    Your faithful service, and your toil in war;
    Yet never have you tasted our reward,
    Or been reguerdon'd with so much as thanks,
    Because till now we never saw your face.
    Therefore stand up; and for these good deserts
    We here create you Earl of Shrewsbury;
    And in our coronation take your place.
              Sennet. Flourish. Exeunt all but VERNON and BASSET
  VERNON. 
25

GLOUCESTER
OUCESTER. Now, Governor of Paris, take your oath
  GLOUCESTER.

LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
OUCESTER. Now, Governor of Paris, take your oath
                                               [GOVERNOR kneels]
    That you elect no other king but him,
    Esteem none friends but such as are his friends,
    And none your foes but such as shall pretend
    Malicious practices against his state.
    This shall ye do, so help you righteous God!
                                   Exeunt GOVERNOR and his train
  FASTOLFE. 
25

NG HENRY. Stain to thy countrymen, thou hear'st thy
    doom.
    Be packing, therefore, thou that wast a knight;
    Henceforth we banish thee on pain of death.
                                                   Exit FASTOLFE
  GLOUCESTER.

ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
VERNON
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
NG HENRY. Come hither, you that would be combatants:
    Henceforth I charge you, as you love our favour,
    Quite to forget this quarrel and the cause.
    And you, my lords, remember where we are:
    In France, amongst a fickle wavering nation;
    If they perceive dissension in our looks
    And that within ourselves we disagree,
    How will their grudging stomachs be provok'd
    To wilful disobedience, and rebel!
    Beside, what infamy will there arise
    When foreign princes shall be certified
    That for a toy, a thing of no regard,
    King Henry's peers and chief nobility
    Destroy'd themselves and lost the realm of France!
    O, think upon the conquest of my father,
    My tender years; and let us not forgo
    That for a trifle that was bought with blood!
    Let me be umpire in this doubtful strife.
    I see no reason, if I wear this rose,
                                         [Putting on a red rose]
    That any one should therefore be suspicious
    I more incline to Somerset than York:
    Both are my kinsmen, and I love them both.
    As well they may upbraid me with my crown,
    Because, forsooth, the King of Scots is crown'd.
    But your discretions better can persuade
    Than I am able to instruct or teach;
    And, therefore, as we hither came in peace,
    So let us still continue peace and love.
    Cousin of York, we institute your Grace
    To be our Regent in these parts of France.
    And, good my Lord of Somerset, unite
    Your troops of horsemen with his bands of foot;
    And like true subjects, sons of your progenitors,
    Go cheerfully together and digest
    Your angry choler on your enemies.
    Ourself, my Lord Protector, and the rest,
    After some respite will return to Calais;
    From thence to England, where I hope ere long
    To be presented by your victories
    With Charles, Alencon, and that traitorous rout.
                         Flourish. Exeunt all but YORK, WARWICK,
  WARWICK. 
26

  YORK.

LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
VERNON
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
ETER. Well didst thou, Richard, to suppress thy voice;
    For had the passions of thy heart burst out,
    I fear we should have seen decipher'd there
    More rancorous spite, more furious raging broils,
    Than yet can be imagin'd or suppos'd.
    But howsoe'er, no simple man that sees
    This jarring discord of nobility,
    This shouldering of each other in the court,
    This factious bandying of their favourites,
    But that it doth presage some ill event.
    'Tis much when sceptres are in children's hands;
    But more when envy breeds unkind division:
    There comes the ruin, there begins confusion.           Exit
                               SCENE 2.
                        France. Before Bordeaux
  TALBOT.

  TALBOT. 
27
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
VERNON
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
YORK
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
LBOT. He fables not; I hear the enemy.
    Out, some light horsemen, and peruse their wings.
    O, negligent and heedless discipline!
    How are we park'd and bounded in a pale
    A little herd of England's timorous deer,
    Maz'd with a yelping kennel of French curs!
    If we be English deer, be then in blood;
    Not rascal-like to fall down with a pinch,
    But rather, moody-mad and desperate stags,
    Turn on the bloody hounds with heads of steel
    And make the cowards stand aloof at bay.
    Sell every man his life as dear as mine,
    And they shall find dear deer of us, my friends.
    God and Saint George, Talbot and England's right,
    Prosper our colours in this dangerous fight!          Exeunt
                          SCENE 3.
                      Plains in Gascony
  YORK.

SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
RK. A plague upon that villain Somerset
    That thus delays my promised supply
    Of horsemen that were levied for this siege!
    Renowned Talbot doth expect my aid,
    And I am louted by a traitor villain
    And cannot help the noble chevalier.
    God comfort him in this necessity!
    If he miscarry, farewell wars in France.
  LUCY.

ENGLISH SOLDIER

VERNON

MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN

DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SOMERSET

SALISBURY
SIR WILLIAM LUCY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
YORK
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
CY. Thus, while the vulture of sedition
    Feeds in the bosom of such great commanders,
    Sleeping neglection doth betray to loss
    The conquest of our scarce cold conqueror,
    That ever-living man of memory,
    Henry the Fifth. Whiles they each other cross,
    Lives, honours, lands, and all, hurry to loss.          Exit

                     Other plains of Gascony
  SOMERSET.

SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
CY. The fraud of England, not the force of France,
  SOMERSET.

RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
LBOT. Then follow thou thy desp'rate sire of Crete,
    Thou Icarus; thy life to me is sweet.
    If thou wilt fight, fight by thy father's side;
    And, commendable prov'd, let's die in pride.          Exeunt
                               SCENE 7.
                      Another part of the field
  TALBOT. 
29
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
VERNON
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SOMERSET
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
SIR WILLIAM LUCY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
YORK
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
LBOT. Where is my other life? Mine own is gone.
  TALBOT. 
30
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
VERNON
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SOMERSET
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
JOHN TALBOT
SIR WILLIAM LUCY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
YORK
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
LBOT. Where is my other life? Mine own is gone.
    O, where's young Talbot? Where is valiant John?
    Triumphant death, smear'd with captivity,
    Young Talbot's valour makes me smile at thee.
    When he perceiv'd me shrink and on my knee,
    His bloody sword he brandish'd over me,
    And like a hungry lion did commence
    Rough deeds of rage and stern impatience;
    But when my angry guardant stood alone,
    Tend'ring my ruin and assail'd of none,
    Dizzy-ey'd fury and great rage of heart
    Suddenly made him from my side to start
    Into the clust'ring battle of the French;
    And in that sea of blood my boy did drench
    His overmounting spirit; and there died,
    My Icarus, my blossom, in his pride.
  SERVANT. 
30
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY

JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
RVANT. O my dear lord, lo where your son is borne!
  TALBOT.

  TALBOT.

VERNON

CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SOMERSET
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
JOHN TALBOT
SIR WILLIAM LUCY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
YORK
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
LBOT. Thou antic Death, which laugh'st us here to scorn,
    Anon, from thy insulting tyranny,
    Coupled in bonds of perpetuity,
    Two Talbots, winged through the lither sky,
    In thy despite shall scape mortality.
    O thou whose wounds become hard-favoured Death,
    Speak to thy father ere thou yield thy breath!
    Brave Death by speaking, whether he will or no;
    Imagine him a Frenchman and thy foe.
    Poor boy! he smiles, methinks, as who should say,
    Had Death been French, then Death had died to-day.
    Come, come, and lay him in his father's arms.
    My spirit can no longer bear these harms.
    Soldiers, adieu! I have what I would have,
    Now my old arms are young John Talbot's grave.        [Dies]
  CHARLES. 
30
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY

TALBOT

GLOUCESTER
ARLES. Had York and Somerset brought rescue in,
  BASTARD.

ARLES. So we be rid of them, do with them what thou
    wilt.
    And now to Paris in this conquering vein!
    All will be ours, now bloody Talbot's slain.          Exeunt
  KING

SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
Cardinal
GLOUCESTER
NG HENRY. Marriage, uncle! Alas, my years are young
    And fitter is my study and my books
    Than wanton dalliance with a paramour.
    Yet call th' ambassadors, and, as you please,
    So let them have their answers every one.
    I shall be well content with any choice
    Tends to God's glory and my country's weal.
  EXETER. 
32

  KING

Cardinal
GLOUCESTER
NG HENRY.  [To AMBASSADOR]  In argument and proof of
    which contract,
    Bear her this jewel, pledge of my affection.
    And so, my Lord Protector, see them guarded
    And safely brought to Dover; where inshipp'd,
    Commit them to the fortune of the sea.
                        Exeunt all but WINCHESTER and the LEGATE
  WINCHESTER.

EARLS OF SOMERSET
Cardinal
GLOUCESTER
NCHESTER.  [Aside]  Now Winchester will not submit, I
    trow,
    Or be inferior to the proudest peer.
    Humphrey of Gloucester, thou shalt well perceive
    That neither in birth or for authority
    The Bishop will be overborne by thee.
    I'll either make thee stoop and bend thy knee,
    Or sack this country with a mutiny.                   Exeunt
                              SCENE 2.
                       France. Plains in Anjou
  CHARLES.

  PUCELLE. 
34
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
VERNON
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
SIR WILLIAM Lucy
FIENDS
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
SCOUT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SOMERSET
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
JOHN TALBOT
SIR WILLIAM LUCY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
YORK
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
Cardinal
GLOUCESTER
CELLE. The Regent conquers and the Frenchmen fly.
    Now help, ye charming spells and periapts;
    And ye choice spirits that admonish me
    And give me signs of future accidents;             [Thunder]
    You speedy helpers that are substitutes
    Under the lordly monarch of the north,
    Appear and aid me in this enterprise!
  PUCELLE. 
35
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
VERNON
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
SIR WILLIAM Lucy
FIENDS
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
French
SCOUT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SOMERSET
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
JOHN TALBOT
SIR WILLIAM LUCY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
YORK
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
Cardinal
GLOUCESTER
CELLE. The Regent conquers and the Frenchmen fly.
    Now help, ye charming spells and periapts;
    And ye choice spirits that admonish me
    And give me signs of future accidents;             [Thunder]
    You speedy helpers that are substitutes
    Under the lordly monarch of the north,
    Appear and aid me in this enterprise!
    This speedy and quick appearance argues proof
    Of your accustom'd diligence to me.
    Now, ye familiar spirits that are cull'd
    Out of the powerful regions under earth,
    Help me this once, that France may get the field.
                                       [They walk and speak not]
    O, hold me not with silence over-long!
    Where I was wont to feed you with my blood,
    I'll lop a member off and give it you
    In earnest of a further benefit,
    So you do condescend to help me now.
                                         [They hang their heads]
    No hope to have redress? My body shall
    Pay recompense, if you will grant my suit.
                                        [They shake their heads]
    Cannot my body nor blood sacrifice
    Entreat you to your wonted furtherance?
    Then take my soul-my body, soul, and all,
    Before that England give the French the foil.
                                                   [They depart]
    See! they forsake me. Now the time is come
    That France must vail her lofty-plumed crest
    And let her head fall into England's lap.
    My ancient incantations are too weak,
    And hell too strong for me to buckle with.
    Now, France, thy glory droopeth to the dust.            Exit
  YORK. 
35

  PUCELLE.

SOMERSET
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
JOHN TALBOT
SIR WILLIAM LUCY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
YORK
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
SUFFOLK
EARLS OF SOMERSET
Cardinal
GLOUCESTER
FFOLK. An earl I am, and Suffolk am I call'd.
  MARGARET. 
36

TALBOT
VERNON
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
SIR WILLIAM Lucy
FIENDS
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
French
SCOUT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SOMERSET
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
JOHN TALBOT
SIR WILLIAM LUCY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
YORK
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
SUFFOLK
EARLS OF SOMERSET
Cardinal
GLOUCESTER
RGARET. I am unworthy to be Henry's wife.
  SUFFOLK.

FFOLK. Then call our captains and our colours forth!
    And, madam, at your father's castle walls
    We'll crave a parley to confer with him.
  REIGNIER.

    To send such peevish tokens to a king.
                                    Exeunt REIGNIER and MARGARET
  SUFFOLK.

SOMERSET
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
JOHN TALBOT
SIR WILLIAM LUCY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
YORK
DUKE OF BURGUNDY
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
SUFFOLK
EARLS OF SOMERSET
Cardinal
GLOUCESTER
FFOLK. O, wert thou for myself! But, Suffolk, stay;
    Thou mayst not wander in that labyrinth:
    There Minotaurs and ugly treasons lurk.
    Solicit Henry with her wondrous praise.
    Bethink thee on her virtues that surmount,
    And natural graces that extinguish art;
    Repeat their semblance often on the seas,
    That, when thou com'st to kneel at Henry's feet,
    Thou mayst bereave him of his wits with wonder.         Exit
                               SCENE 4.
                  Camp of the DUKE OF YORK in Anjou
  YORK. 
36

BOY

RK. Bring forth that sorceress, condemn'd to burn.
  SHEPHERD.

RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
SUFFOLK
EARLS OF SOMERSET

GLOUCESTER
RK. Is all our travail turn'd to this effect?
  WARWICK.

SUFFOLK
EARLS OF SOMERSET
Cardinal
GLOUCESTER
RK. Then swear allegiance to his Majesty:
    As thou art knight, never to disobey
    Nor be rebellious to the crown of England
    Thou, nor thy nobles, to the crown of England.
                    [CHARLES and the rest give tokens of fealty]
    So, now dismiss your army when ye please;
    Hang up your ensigns, let your drums be still,
    For here we entertain a solemn peace.                 Exeunt
                              SCENE 5.
                         London. The palace
  KING

0
NG HENRY THE SIXTH
  DUKE 
0
KE OF GLOUCESTER, uncle to the King, and Protector
  DUKE 
0
KE OF BEDFORD, uncle to the King, and Regent of France
  THOMAS 
0
OMAS BEAUFORT, DUKE OF EXETER, great-uncle to the king
  HENRY 
0
NRY BEAUFORT, great-uncle to the King, BISHOP OF WINCHESTER, and afterwards CARDINAL
  JOHN 
0
HN BEAUFORT, EARL OF SOMERSET, afterwards Duke
  RICHARD 
0

UNTESS OF AUVERGNE

0
AN LA PUCELLE, Commonly called JOAN OF ARC
  JOAN 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
AN LA PUCELLE, Commonly called JOAN OF ARC
    to La Pucelle
  BEDFORD. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Hung be the heavens with black, yield day to
  GLOUCESTER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. England ne'er had a king until his time.
  EXETER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. We mourn in black; why mourn we not in blood?
  WINCHESTER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NCHESTER. He was a king bless'd of the King of kings;
  GLOUCESTER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. The Church! Where is it? Had not churchmen
  WINCHESTER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NCHESTER. Gloucester, whate'er we like, thou art
  GLOUCESTER. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. Name not religion, for thou lov'st the flesh;
  BEDFORD. 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Cease, cease these jars and rest your minds in peace;
  HENRY 
1
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NRY the Fifth, thy ghost I invocate:
  HENRY 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NRY the Fifth, thy ghost I invocate:
    Prosper this realm, keep it from civil broils,
    Combat with adverse planets in the heavens.
    A far more glorious star thy soul will make
    Than Julius Caesar or bright
  MESSENGER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
SSENGER. My honourable lords, health to you all!
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. What say'st thou, man, before dead Henry's corse?
  GLOUCESTER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. Is Paris lost? Is Rouen yielded up?
  EXETER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. How were they lost? What treachery was us'd?
  MESSENGER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
SSENGER. No treachery, but want of men and money.
  EXETER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. Were our tears wanting to this funeral,
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Me they concern; Regent I am of France.
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Me they concern; Regent I am of France.
    Give me my steeled coat; I'll fight for France.
    Away with these disgraceful wailing robes!
    Wounds will I lend the French instead of eyes,
    To weep their intermissive miseries.
  SECOND 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
COND MESSENGER. Lords, view these letters full of bad
  EXETER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. The Dauphin crowned king! all fly to him!
  GLOUCESTER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. We will not fly but to our enemies' throats.
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Gloucester, why doubt'st thou of my forwardness?
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Gloucester, why doubt'st thou of my forwardness?
    An army have I muster'd in my thoughts,
    Wherewith already France is overrun.
  THIRD 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
IRD MESSENGER. My gracious lords, to add to your
  WINCHESTER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NCHESTER. What! Wherein Talbot overcame? Is't so?
  THIRD 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
IRD MESSENGER. O, no; wherein Lord Talbot was
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. Is Talbot slain? Then I will slay myself,
  THIRD 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
IRD MESSENGER. O no, he lives, but is took prisoner,
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. His ransom there is none but I shall pay.
  THIRD 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
IRD MESSENGER. So you had need; for Orleans is besieg'd;
  EXETER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. Remember, lords, your oaths to Henry sworn,
  BEDFORD. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DFORD. I do remember it, and here take my leave
  GLOUCESTER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
OUCESTER. I'll to the Tower with all the haste I can
  EXETER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
ETER. To Eltham will I, where the young King is,
  WINCHESTER. 
2
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
NCHESTER.  [Aside]  Each hath his place and function to
  WINCHESTER. 
3
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
NCHESTER.  [Aside]  Each hath his place and function to
    attend:
    I am left out; for me nothing remains.
    But long I will not be Jack out of office.
    The King from Eltham I intend to steal,
    And sit at chiefest stern of public weal.             Exeunt
                          SCENE 2.
                  France. Before Orleans
  CHARLES. 
3
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Mars his true moving, even as in the heavens
  ALENCON. 
3
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. They want their porridge and their fat bull
  REIGNIER. 
3
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. Let's raise the siege. Why live we idly here?
  CHARLES. 
3
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Sound, sound alarum; we will rush on them.
  CHARLES. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Sound, sound alarum; we will rush on them.
    Now for the honour of the forlorn French!
    Him I forgive my death that killeth me,
    When he sees me go back one foot or flee.             Exeunt
       Here alarum. They are beaten hack by the English, with
  CHARLES. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Who ever saw the like? What men have I!
  REIGNIER. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. Salisbury is a desperate homicide;
  ALENCON. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. Froissart, a countryman of ours, records
  CHARLES. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Let's leave this town; for they are hare-brain'd
  REIGNIER. 
4
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. I think by some odd gimmers or device
  ALENCON. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. Be it so.
  BASTARD. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
STARD. Where's the Prince Dauphin? I have news for him.
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Bastard of Orleans, thrice welcome to us.
  BASTARD. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
STARD. Methinks your looks are sad, your cheer appall'd.
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Go, call her in.                       [Exit BASTARD]
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Go, call her in.                       [Exit BASTARD]
    But first, to try her skill,
    Reignier, stand thou as Dauphin in my place;
    Question her proudly; let thy looks be stern;
    By this means shall we sound what skill she hath.
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. Fair maid, is 't thou wilt do these wondrous feats?
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Reignier, is 't thou that thinkest to beguile me?
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. She takes upon her bravely at first dash.
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Dauphin, I am by birth a shepherd's daughter,
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Thou hast astonish'd me with thy high terms.
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. I am prepar'd; here is my keen-edg'd sword,
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Then come, o' God's name; I fear no woman.
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. And while I live I'll ne'er fly from a man.
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Stay, stay thy hands; thou art an Amazon,
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Christ's Mother helps me, else I were too weak.
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Whoe'er helps thee, 'tis thou that must help me.
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. I must not yield to any rites of love,
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Meantime look gracious on thy prostrate thrall.
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. My lord, methinks, is very long in talk.
  ALENCON. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. Doubtless he shrives this woman to her smock;
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. Shall we disturb him, since he keeps no mean?
  ALENCON. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. He may mean more than we poor men do know;
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. My lord, where are you? What devise you on?
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Why, no, I say; distrustful recreants!
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. What she says I'll confirm; we'll fight it out.
  PUCELLE. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Assign'd am I to be the English scourge.
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Was Mahomet inspired with a dove?
  ALENCON. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ENCON. Leave off delays, and let us raise the siege.
  REIGNIER. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. Woman, do what thou canst to save our honours;
  CHARLES. 
5
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
CHARLES
MESSENGER
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Presently we'll try. Come, let's away about it.
  CHARLES. 
6
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. Presently we'll try. Come, let's away about it.
    No prophet will I trust if she prove false.           Exeunt

KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
OUCESTER. Faint-hearted Woodville, prizest him fore me?
  GLOUCESTER. 
7
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
OUCESTER. Faint-hearted Woodville, prizest him fore me?
    Arrogant Winchester, that haughty prelate
    Whom Henry, our late sovereign, ne'er could brook!
    Thou art no friend to God or to the King.
    Open the gates, or I'll shut thee out shortly.
    Or we'll burst them open, if that you come not quickly.
  WINCHESTER. 
7
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
NCHESTER. How now, ambitious Humphry! What means
  GLOUCESTER. 
7
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
OUCESTER. Peel'd priest, dost thou command me to be
  WINCHESTER.

KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
NCHESTER. I do, thou most usurping proditor,
  GLOUCESTER.

  GLOUCESTER. 
8
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
OUCESTER. Winchester goose! I cry 'A rope, a rope!'
    Now beat them hence; why do you let them stay?
    Thee I'll chase hence, thou wolf in sheep's array.
    Out, tawny-coats! Out, scarlet hypocrite!
         Here GLOUCESTER'S men beat out the CARDINAL'S
  MAYOR.

LISBURY. Talbot, my life, my joy, again return'd!

PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. The Earl of Bedford had a prisoner
  SALISBURY. 
9
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LISBURY. Yet tell'st thou not how thou wert entertain'd.
  TALBOT. 
9
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. With scoffs, and scorns, and contumelious taunts,
  TALBOT. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. With scoffs, and scorns, and contumelious taunts,
    In open market-place produc'd they me
    To be a public spectacle to all;
    Here, said they, is the terror of the French,
    The scarecrow that affrights our children so.
    Then broke I from the officers that led me,
    And with my nails digg'd stones out of the ground
    To hurl at the beholders of my shame;
    My grisly countenance made others fly;
    None durst come near for fear of sudden death.
    In iron walls they deem'd me not secure;
    So great fear of my name 'mongst them was spread
    That they suppos'd I could rend bars of steel
    And spurn in pieces posts of adamant;
    Wherefore a guard of chosen shot I had
    That walk'd about me every minute-while;
    And if I did but stir out of my bed,
    Ready they were to shoot me to the heart.
  SALISBURY. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LISBURY. I grieve to hear what torments you endur'd;
  GARGRAVE.

10
BOY

KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES

SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
RGRAVE. O Lord, have mercy on me, woeful man!
  TALBOT. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. What chance is this that suddenly hath cross'd us?
  TALBOT. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. What chance is this that suddenly hath cross'd us?
    Speak, Salisbury; at least, if thou canst speak.
    How far'st thou, mirror of all martial men?
    One of thy eyes and thy cheek's side struck off!
    Accursed tower! accursed fatal hand
    That hath contriv'd this woeful tragedy!
    In thirteen battles Salisbury o'ercame;
    Henry the Fifth he first train'd to the wars;
    Whilst any trump did sound or drum struck up,
    His sword did ne'er leave striking in the field.
    Yet liv'st thou, Salisbury? Though thy speech doth fail,
    One eye thou hast to look to heaven for grace;
    The sun with one eye vieweth all the world.
    Heaven, be thou gracious to none alive
    If Salisbury wants mercy at thy hands!
    Bear hence his body; I will help to bury it.
    Sir Thomas Gargrave, hast thou any life?
    Speak unto Talbot; nay, look up to him.
    Salisbury, cheer thy spirit with this comfort,
    Thou shalt not die whiles
    He beckons with his hand and smiles on me,
    As who should say 'When I am dead and gone,
    Remember to avenge me on the French.'
    Plantagenet, I will; and like thee, Nero,
    Play on the lute, beholding the towns burn.
    Wretched shall France be only in my name.
                  [Here an alarum, and it thunders and lightens]
    What stir is this? What tumult's in the heavens?
    Whence cometh this alarum and the noise?
  MESSENGER. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
SSENGER. My lord, my lord, the French have gather'd
  TALBOT. 
10
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. Hear, hear how dying Salisbury doth groan.
  TALBOT. 
12
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. Hear, hear how dying Salisbury doth groan.
    It irks his heart he cannot be reveng'd.
    Frenchmen, I'll be a Salisbury to you.
    Pucelle or puzzel, dolphin or dogfish,
    Your hearts I'll stamp out with my horse's heels
    And make a quagmire of your mingled brains.
    Convey me Salisbury into his tent,
    And then we'll try what these dastard Frenchmen dare.
                                                  Alarum. Exeunt
                             SCENE 5.
                          Before Orleans
         Here an alarum again, and TALBOT pursueth the
  TALBOT. 
12

LA PUCELLE
BOY

SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. Where is my strength, my valour, and my force?
    Our English troops retire, I cannot stay them;
    A woman clad in armour chaseth them.
  PUCELLE.

13
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. My thoughts are whirled like a potter's wheel;
  TALBOT. 
12
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LBOT. My thoughts are whirled like a potter's wheel;
    I know not where I am nor what I do.
    A witch by fear, not force, like Hannibal,
    Drives back our troops and conquers as she lists.
    So bees with smoke and doves with noisome stench
    Are from their hives and houses driven away.
    They call'd us, for our fierceness, English dogs;
    Now like to whelps we crying run away.
                                                [A short alarum]
    Hark, countrymen! Either renew the fight
    Or tear the lions out of England's coat;
    Renounce your soil, give sheep in lions' stead:
    Sheep run not half so treacherous from the wolf,
    Or horse or oxen from the leopard,
    As you fly from your oft subdued slaves.
                                 [Alarum. Here another skirmish]
    It will not be-retire into your trenches.
    You all consented unto Salisbury's death,
    For none would strike a stroke in his revenge.
    Pucelle is ent'red into Orleans
    In spite of us or aught that we could do.
    O, would I were to die with Salisbury!
    The shame hereof will make me hide my head.
                                    Exit TALBOT. Alarum; retreat
  TALBOT. 
12

                             SCENE 6.
                              ORLEANS
  PUCELLE.

LA PUCELLE

  CHARLES. 
13
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ARLES. 'Tis Joan, not we, by whom the day is won;
    For which I will divide my crown with her;
    And all the priests and friars in my realm
    Shall in procession sing her endless praise.
    A statelier pyramis to her I'll rear
    Than Rhodope's of Memphis ever was.
    In memory of her, when she is dead,
    Her ashes, in an urn more precious
    Than the rich jewel'd coffer of Darius,
    Transported shall be at high festivals
    Before the kings and queens of France.
    No longer on Saint Denis will we cry,
    But Joan la Pucelle shall be France's saint.
    Come in, and let us banquet royally
    After this golden day of victory. Flourish.           Exeunt
  SERGEANT. 
13
LA PUCELLE

    Thus are poor servitors,
    When others sleep upon their quiet beds,
    Constrain'd to watch in darkness, rain, and cold.
  TALBOT.

CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
IGNIER. And so was mine, my lord.

15
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
CELLE. Question, my lords, no further of the case,
    How or which way; 'tis sure they found some place
    But weakly guarded, where the breach was made.
    And now there rests no other shift but this
    To gather our soldiers, scatter'd and dispers'd,
    And lay new platforms to endamage them.
  SOLDIER. 
15

SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
LDIER. I'll be so bold to take what they have left.
    The cry of Talbot serves me for a sword;
    For I have loaden me with many spoils,
    Using no other weapon but his name.                     Exit

RGUNDY. Myself, as far as I could well discern
  BURGUNDY. 
15
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
RGUNDY. Myself, as far as I could well discern
    For smoke and dusky vapours of the night,
    Am sure I scar'd the Dauphin and his trull,
    When arm in arm they both came swiftly running,
    Like to a pair of loving turtle-doves
    That could not live asunder day or night.
    After that things are set in order here,
    We'll follow them with all the power we have.
  MESSENGER.

LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
TALBOT
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
UNTESS. The plot is laid; if all things fall out right,
    I shall as famous be by this exploit.
    As Scythian Tomyris by Cyrus' death.
    Great is the rumour of this dreadful knight,
    And his achievements of no less account.
    Fain would mine eyes be witness with mine ears
    To give their censure of these rare reports.
  MESSENGER. 
16

EARLS OF SOMERSET
TALBOT
PORTER With
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ANTAGENET. Since you are tongue-tied and so loath to speak,
  SOMERSET.

    Come, let us four to dinner. I dare say
    This quarrel will drink blood another day.            Exeunt
                             SCENE 5.
                       The Tower of London
  MORTIMER.

  FIRST

19
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER

SALISBURY

PROTECTOR

CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
RTIMER. Enough; my soul shall then be satisfied.
  MORTIMER. 
20
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
TALBOT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
RTIMER. Enough; my soul shall then be satisfied.
    Poor gentleman! his wrong doth equal mine.
    Since Henry Monmouth first began to reign,
    Before whose glory I was great in arms,
    This loathsome sequestration have I had;
    And even since then hath Richard been obscur'd,
    Depriv'd of honour and inheritance.
    But now the arbitrator of despairs,
    Just Death, kind umpire of men's miseries,
    With sweet enlargement doth dismiss me hence.
    I would his troubles likewise were expir'd,
    That so he might recover what was lost.
  FIRST 
20

LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
TALBOT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ANTAGENET. Of Which, my lord, your honour is the last.
  MORTIMER. 
20

RTIMER. True; and thou seest that I no issue have,
  PLANTAGENET.

20
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
TALBOT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ANTAGENET. And peace, no war, befall thy parting soul!
    In prison hast thou spent a pilgrimage,
    And like a hermit overpass'd thy days.
    Well, I will lock his counsel in my breast;
    And what I do imagine, let that rest.
    Keepers, convey him hence; and I myself
    Will see his burial better than his life.
                Exeunt GAOLERS, hearing out the body of MORTIMER
  PLANTAGENET. 
21
LA PUCELLE
BOY
MAYOR OF
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
ENGLISH SOLDIER
FRENCH SERGEANT
CHARLES
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
TALBOT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
SALISBURY
MESSENGER
PROTECTOR
COUNTESS
KING
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
ANTAGENET. And peace, no war, befall thy parting soul!
    In prison hast thou spent a pilgrimage,
    And like a hermit overpass'd thy days.
    Well, I will lock his counsel in my breast;
    And what I do imagine, let that rest.
    Keepers, convey him hence; and I myself
    Will see his burial better than his life.
                Exeunt GAOLERS, hearing out the body of MORTIMER
    Here dies the dusky torch of Mortimer,
    Chok'd with ambition of the meaner sort;
    And for those wrongs, those bitter injuries,
    Which Somerset hath offer'd to my house,
    I doubt not but with honour to redress;
    And therefore haste I to the Parliament,
    Either to be restored to my blood,
    Or make my ill th' advantage of my good.                Exit
  WINCHESTER. 
21

RWICK. An uproar, I dare warrant,

  MAYOR.

23
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
YOR. O, my good lords, and virtuous Henry,
    Pity the city of London, pity us!
    The Bishop and the Duke of Gloucester's men,
    Forbidden late to carry any weapon,
    Have fill'd their pockets full of pebble stones
    And, banding themselves in contrary parts,
    Do pelt so fast at one another's pate
    That many have their giddy brains knock'd out.
    Our windows are broke down in every street,
    And we for fear compell'd to shut our shops.
  KING 
23

NG HENRY. We charge you, on allegiance to ourself,
  FIRST

ETER. Ay, we may march in England or in France,
  EXETER. 
23
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
ETER. Ay, we may march in England or in France,
    Not seeing what is likely to ensue.
    This late dissension grown betwixt the peers
    Burns under feigned ashes of forg'd love
    And will at last break out into a flame;
    As fest'red members rot but by degree
    Till bones and flesh and sinews fall away,
    So will this base and envious discord breed.
    And now I fear that fatal prophecy.
    Which in the time of Henry nam'd the Fifth
    Was in the mouth of every sucking babe:
    That Henry born at Monmouth should win all,
    And Henry born at Windsor should lose all.
    Which is so plain that Exeter doth wish
    His days may finish ere that hapless time.              Exit
                             SCENE 2.
                      France. Before Rouen
  PUCELLE. 
23

MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
ENCON. Defer no time, delays have dangerous ends;
  ALENCON. 
23
LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
ENCON. Defer no time, delays have dangerous ends;
    Enter, and cry 'The Dauphin!' presently,
    And then do execution on the watch. Alarum.           Exeunt
  TALBOT. 
23

  PUCELLE,

MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN

BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
CELLE, that witch, that damned sorceress,
    Hath wrought this hellish mischief unawares,
    That hardly we escap'd the pride of France.             Exit
        An alarum; excursions. BEDFORD brought in sick in
  PUCELLE. 
23

  BURGUNDY.

LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON
PROTECTOR
CHARLES THE DAUPHIN
KING
DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
BASTARD OF ORLEANS
COUNTESS
SALISBURY
KING HENRY THE FIFTH
FRENCH SERGEANT
PORTER With
SIR JOHN FASTOLFE
RICHARD PLANTAGENET
JOAN LA PUCELLE
MORTIMER
EARLS OF SOMERSET
GLOUCESTER
LBOT. Undaunted spirit in a dying breast!
    Then be it so. Heavens keep old Bedford safe!
    And now no more ado, brave Burgundy,
    But gather we our forces out of hand
    And set upon our boasting enemy.
          Exeunt against the town all but BEDFORD and attendants
  CAPTAIN.

LA PUCELLE
CHARLES
BOY
ENGLISH SOLDIER
MAYOR OF
TALBOT
MESSENGER
MAYOR OF LONDON

DUKE OF GLOUCESTER
