  REIGNIER. 
1
CHARLES
IGNIER. I think by some odd gimmers or device
  ALENCON. 
1
CHARLES
ENCON. Be it so.
  BASTARD. 
1
CHARLES
STARD. Where's the Prince Dauphin? I have news for him.
  CHARLES. 
1
CHARLES
ARLES. Bastard of Orleans, thrice welcome to us.
  BASTARD. 
1
CHARLES
STARD. Methinks your looks are sad, your cheer appall'd.
  CHARLES. 
1
CHARLES
ARLES. Go, call her in.                       [Exit BASTARD]
  CHARLES. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ARLES. Go, call her in.                       [Exit BASTARD]
    But first, to try her skill,
    Reignier, stand thou as Dauphin in my place;
    Question her proudly; let thy looks be stern;
    By this means shall we sound what skill she hath.
  REIGNIER. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
IGNIER. Fair maid, is 't thou wilt do these wondrous feats?
  PUCELLE. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
CELLE. Reignier, is 't thou that thinkest to beguile me?
  REIGNIER. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
IGNIER. She takes upon her bravely at first dash.
  PUCELLE. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
CELLE. Dauphin, I am by birth a shepherd's daughter,
  CHARLES. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ARLES. Thou hast astonish'd me with thy high terms.
  PUCELLE. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
CELLE. I am prepar'd; here is my keen-edg'd sword,
  CHARLES. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ARLES. Then come, o' God's name; I fear no woman.
  PUCELLE. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
CELLE. And while I live I'll ne'er fly from a man.
  CHARLES. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ARLES. Stay, stay thy hands; thou art an Amazon,
  PUCELLE. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
CELLE. Christ's Mother helps me, else I were too weak.
  CHARLES. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ARLES. Whoe'er helps thee, 'tis thou that must help me.
  PUCELLE. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
CELLE. I must not yield to any rites of love,
  CHARLES. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ARLES. Meantime look gracious on thy prostrate thrall.
  REIGNIER. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
IGNIER. My lord, methinks, is very long in talk.
  ALENCON. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ENCON. Doubtless he shrives this woman to her smock;
  REIGNIER. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
IGNIER. Shall we disturb him, since he keeps no mean?
  ALENCON. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ENCON. He may mean more than we poor men do know;
  REIGNIER. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
IGNIER. My lord, where are you? What devise you on?
  PUCELLE. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
CELLE. Why, no, I say; distrustful recreants!
  CHARLES. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ARLES. What she says I'll confirm; we'll fight it out.
  PUCELLE. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
CELLE. Assign'd am I to be the English scourge.
  CHARLES. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ARLES. Was Mahomet inspired with a dove?
  ALENCON. 
2
BASTARD
CHARLES
ENCON. Leave off delays, and let us raise the siege.
  REIGNIER.

    Now beat them hence; why do you let them stay?

  TALBOT.

  TALBOT. 
5
TALBOT
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
MAYOR
LBOT. Hear, hear how dying Salisbury doth groan.
    It irks his heart he cannot be reveng'd.
    Frenchmen, I'll be a Salisbury to you.
    Pucelle or puzzel, dolphin or dogfish,
    Your hearts I'll stamp out with my horse's heels
    And make a quagmire of your mingled brains.
    Convey me Salisbury into his tent,
    And then we'll try what these dastard Frenchmen dare.
                                                  Alarum. Exeunt
                             SCENE 5.
                          Before Orleans
         Here an alarum again, and TALBOT pursueth the
  TALBOT. 
5
TALBOT
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
MAYOR
LBOT. Where is my strength, my valour, and my force?
  PUCELLE. 
5
TALBOT
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
MAYOR
CELLE. Come, come, 'tis only I that must disgrace thee.
  TALBOT. 
5
TALBOT
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
MAYOR
LBOT. Heavens, can you suffer hell so to prevail?
  PUCELLE. 
5
TALBOT
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
MAYOR
CELLE. Talbot, farewell; thy hour is not yet come.
  TALBOT. 
5
TALBOT
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
MAYOR
LBOT. My thoughts are whirled like a potter's wheel;
  TALBOT. 
4
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
MAYOR
LBOT. My thoughts are whirled like a potter's wheel;
    I know not where I am nor what I do.
    A witch by fear, not force, like Hannibal,
    Drives back our troops and conquers as she lists.
    So bees with smoke and doves with noisome stench
    Are from their hives and houses driven away.
    They call'd us, for our fierceness, English dogs;
    Now like to whelps we crying run away.
                                                [A short alarum]
    Hark, countrymen! Either renew the fight
    Or tear the lions out of England's coat;
    Renounce your soil, give sheep in lions' stead:
    Sheep run not half so treacherous from the wolf,
    Or horse or oxen from the leopard,
    As you fly from your oft subdued slaves.
                                 [Alarum. Here another skirmish]
    It will not be-retire into your trenches.
    You all consented unto Salisbury's death,
    For none would strike a stroke in his revenge.
    Pucelle is ent'red into Orleans
    In spite of us or aught that we could do.
    O, would I were to die with Salisbury!
    The shame hereof will make me hide my head.
                                    Exit TALBOT. Alarum; retreat
  PUCELLE.

  PLANTAGENET. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
MAYOR
PORTER
ANTAGENET. And peace, no war, befall thy parting soul!
    In prison hast thou spent a pilgrimage,
    And like a hermit overpass'd thy days.
    Well, I will lock his counsel in my breast;
    And what I do imagine, let that rest.
    Keepers, convey him hence; and I myself
    Will see his burial better than his life.
                Exeunt GAOLERS, hearing out the body of MORTIMER

    Then be it so. Heavens keep old Bedford safe!
    And now no more ado, brave Burgundy,
    But gather we our forces out of hand
    And set upon our boasting enemy.

PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
DFORD. Now, quiet soul, depart when heaven please,
    For I have seen our enemies' overthrow.
    What is the trust or strength of foolish man?
    They that of late were daring with their scoffs
    Are glad and fain by flight to save themselves.
            [BEDFORD dies and is carried in by two in his chair]
  TALBOT.

  GLOUCESTER.

  KING 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
NG HENRY. Welcome, brave captain and victorious lord!
  KING 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
NG HENRY. Welcome, brave captain and victorious lord!
    When I was young, as yet I am not old,
    I do remember how my father said
    A stouter champion never handled sword.
    Long since we were resolved of your truth,
    Your faithful service, and your toil in war;
    Yet never have you tasted our reward,
    Or been reguerdon'd with so much as thanks,
    Because till now we never saw your face.
    Therefore stand up; and for these good deserts
    We here create you Earl of Shrewsbury;
    And in our coronation take your place.
              Sennet. Flourish. Exeunt all but VERNON and BASSET
  VERNON. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
RNON. Now, sir, to you, that were so hot at sea,
  BASSET. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
SSET. Yes, sir; as well as you dare patronage
  VERNON.

  GLOUCESTER. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
OUCESTER. Now, Governor of Paris, take your oath
                                               [GOVERNOR kneels]
    That you elect no other king but him,
    Esteem none friends but such as are his friends,
    And none your foes but such as shall pretend
    Malicious practices against his state.
    This shall ye do, so help you righteous God!
                                   Exeunt GOVERNOR and his train

  EXETER. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
ETER. It grieves his Highness. Good my lords, be friends.
  KING 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
NG HENRY. Come hither, you that would be combatants:
  KING 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
NG HENRY. Come hither, you that would be combatants:
    Henceforth I charge you, as you love our favour,
    Quite to forget this quarrel and the cause.
    And you, my lords, remember where we are:
    In France, amongst a fickle wavering nation;
    If they perceive dissension in our looks
    And that within ourselves we disagree,
    How will their grudging stomachs be provok'd
    To wilful disobedience, and rebel!
    Beside, what infamy will there arise
    When foreign princes shall be certified
    That for a toy, a thing of no regard,
    King Henry's peers and chief nobility
    Destroy'd themselves and lost the realm of France!
    O, think upon the conquest of my father,
    My tender years; and let us not forgo
    That for a trifle that was bought with blood!
    Let me be umpire in this doubtful strife.
    I see no reason, if I wear this rose,
                                         [Putting on a red rose]
    That any one should therefore be suspicious
    I more incline to Somerset than York:
    Both are my kinsmen, and I love them both.
    As well they may upbraid me with my crown,
    Because, forsooth, the King of Scots is crown'd.
    But your discretions better can persuade
    Than I am able to instruct or teach;
    And, therefore, as we hither came in peace,
    So let us still continue peace and love.
    Cousin of York, we institute your Grace
    To be our Regent in these parts of France.
    And, good my Lord of Somerset, unite
    Your troops of horsemen with his bands of foot;
    And like true subjects, sons of your progenitors,
    Go cheerfully together and digest
    Your angry choler on your enemies.
    Ourself, my Lord Protector, and the rest,
    After some respite will return to Calais;
    From thence to England, where I hope ere long
    To be presented by your victories
    With Charles, Alencon, and that traitorous rout.
                         Flourish. Exeunt all but YORK, WARWICK,
  WARWICK. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES

NG HENRY.  [To AMBASSADOR]  In argument and proof of
  KING 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
NG HENRY.  [To AMBASSADOR]  In argument and proof of
    which contract,
    Bear her this jewel, pledge of my affection.
    And so, my Lord Protector, see them guarded
    And safely brought to Dover; where inshipp'd,
    Commit them to the fortune of the sea.
                        Exeunt all but WINCHESTER and the LEGATE
  WINCHESTER.

PUCELLE

CHARLES
TALBOT

  LEGATE.

  CHARLES.

  BURGUNDY.

TALBOT

RGUNDY. I trust the ghost of Talbot is not there.
  PUCELLE. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
CELLE. Of all base passions fear is most accurs'd.
  CHARLES. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER

  PUCELLE. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
CELLE. The Regent conquers and the Frenchmen fly.
  YORK. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
RK. Damsel of France, I think I have you fast.
  PUCELLE. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
CELLE. Chang'd to a worser shape thou canst not be.
  YORK. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
RK. O, Charles the Dauphin is a proper man:
  PUCELLE. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
CELLE. A plaguing mischief fight on Charles and thee!
  YORK. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
RK. Fell banning hag; enchantress, hold thy tongue.
  PUCELLE. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
CELLE. I prithee give me leave to curse awhile.
  YORK. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
RK. Curse, miscreant, when thou comest to the stake.
  SUFFOLK. 
5
PUCELLE
BASTARD
CHARLES
TALBOT
PORTER
FFOLK. Be what thou wilt, thou art my prisoner.
  MARGARET.

TALBOT

  SUFFOLK.

CHARLES
TALBOT

  MARGARET.

CHARLES
TALBOT

  MARGARET.

TALBOT

  SUFFOLK.

CHARLES
TALBOT

  MARGARET.

TALBOT

  SUFFOLK.

  MARGARET.

TALBOT

  SUFFOLK.

  MARGARET.
